answers.answer: HI and thanks for using the forum.Congratulations on your pregnancy!  What wonderful news.  It is important to keep your blood sugars in check throughout your pregnancy and it can be hard to do.  Are you seeing a high risk OB?  Do you see an endocrinologist for your diabetes?  YOu need to discuss with your ob your blood sugar goals and management.  Many women use insulin injections to control their blood sugars during pregnancy along with diet and exercise.  YOu need to discuss these options with your doctor.  A fasting blood sugar in the 160's is elevated, so you want to discuss your options with your doctor.  Good luck and congratulations.Bridget
